member.name: M:Vi.API.Wtsapi32.WTSQuerySessionInformationW(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,Vi.API.Wtsapi32.WTS_INFO_CLASS,System.IntPtr@,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Retrieves session information for the specified session on the specified Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server. It can be used to query session information on local and remote RD Session Host servers.
member.param: A handle to an RD (Remote Desktop) Session Host server. Specify a handle opened by the WTSOpenServer function, or specify WTS_CURRENT_SERVER_HANDLE to indicate the RD Session Host server on which your application is running.

A Remote Desktop Services session identifier. To indicate the session in which the calling application is running (or the current session) specify WTS_CURRENT_SESSION. Only specify WTS_CURRENT_SESSION when obtaining session information on the local server. If WTS_CURRENT_SESSION is specified when querying session information on a remote server, the returned session information will be inconsistent. Do not use the returned data.
A value of the WTS_INFO_CLASS enumeration that indicates the type of session information to retrieve in a call to the WTSQuerySessionInformation function.

A pointer to a variable that receives a pointer to the requested information. The format and contents of the data depend on the information class specified in the WTSInfoClass parameter. To free the returned buffer, call the WTSFreeMemory function.
A pointer to a variable that receives the size, in bytes, of the data returned in ppBuffer.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a nonzero value. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: T:Vi.API.Wtsapi32.WTS_INFO_CLASS
member.summary: Contains values that indicate the type of session information to retrieve in a call to the WTSQuerySessionInformation function.

member.name: F:Vi.API.Wtsapi32.WTS_INFO_CLASS.WTSInitialProgram
member.summary: A null-terminated string that contains the name of the initial program that Remote Desktop Services runs when the user logs on.

member.name: F:Vi.API.Wtsapi32.WTS_INFO_CLASS.WTSApplicationName
member.summary: A null-terminated string that contains the published name of the application that the session is running. Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 and Windows Vista: This value is not supported

member.name: F:Vi.API.Wtsapi32.WTS_INFO_CLASS.WTSUserName
member.summary: A null-terminated string that contains the name of the user associated with the session.

member.name: F:Vi.API.Wtsapi32.WTS_INFO_CLASS.WTSWinStationName
member.summary: A null-terminated string that contains the name of the Remote Desktop Services session.

member.name: M:Vi.API.Kernel32.WritePrivateProfileString(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copies a string into the specified section of an initialization file. Using the native unmanaged kernel's function.
member.param: The name of the section to which the string will be copied. If the section does not exist, it is created. The name of the section is case-independent; the string can be any combination of uppercase and lowercase letters.

The name of the key to be associated with a string. If the key does not exist in the specified section, it is created. If this parameter is NULL, the entire section, including all entries within the section, is deleted.
A string to be written to the file. If this parameter is NULL, the key pointed to by the 'key' parameter is deleted.
The name of the initialization file. (If the file was created using Unicode characters, the function writes Unicode characters to the file. Otherwise, the function writes ANSI characters.)
member.returns: If the function successfully copies the string to the initialization file, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, or if it flushes the cached version of the most recently accessed initialization file, the return value is zero.To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: T:Vi.Tools.Extensions.SqlCommand.Methods

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Extensions.SqlCommand.Methods.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Func{System.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReader,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Esegue il command ottenendo un 'DataReader'. Se per il 'DataReader', 'HasRows = true' e 'dr.Read = true' cicla sul 'DataReader' ed evoca la 'callBack' ad ogni iterazione.
member.param: Il command da eseguire.
La callback da eseguire su ogni singola riga dati del 'DataReader'.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Extensions.SqlCommand.Methods.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Action{System.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReader},System.Func{System.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReader,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Esegue il command ottenendo un 'DataReader'. Se per il 'DataReader', 'HasRows = true' e 'dr.Read = true' cicla sul 'DataReader' ed evoca la 'callBack' ad ogni iterazione.
member.param: Il command da eseguire.
La callback da eseguire per realizzare una intestazione di tabelle dal 'DataReader'.
La callback da eseguire su ogni singola riga dati del 'DataReader'.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Extensions.SqlCommand.Methods.ExecuteReaderAsync(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Action{System.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReader},System.Func{System.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReader,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Implementazione asincrona (semplificata) del metodo executeReader
member.param: L'oggetto con le 'istruzioni' per interrogare il DB.
CallBack da eseguire non appena ricevuto il dataReader. Dovrebbe contenere i comandi per manipolare le colonne.
CallBack che viene chiamata iterativamente (ad ogni esecuzione di dr.HasRows). Per terminare il loop sul DataReader è sufficiente che il return sia false.

The name of the INI file currently used.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Profile.Sections(System.Int32,System.String,Vi.Tools.Profile.WarningDelegate)
member.summary: Retrives all the 'Sections' in an INI file.
member.param: The name of the initialization file. (If the file was created using Unicode characters, the function writes Unicode characters to the file. Otherwise, the function writes ANSI characters.)
The number of bytes fetched by the method 'GetPrivateProfileString'. If the buffer is not enough to contain all the data. 'GetPrivateProfileString' is acalled again.
The callback used to manage exceptions.
member.returns: The names of all the Sections or an empty array (a zero length array.)

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Profile.Sections(System.String,Vi.Tools.Profile.WarningDelegate)

member.returns: The names of all the Sections.

member.summary: Retrives all the 'Keys' belonging to a 'Sections' in an INI file.
member.param: The name of the section to which the string will be read. If null the callback 'onWarning' will be called.
The full path of the INI file from which read data. If null the callback 'onWarning' will be called.
The number of bytes fetched by the method 'GetPrivateProfileString'. If the buffer is not enough to contain all the data. 'GetPrivateProfileString' is acalled again.
The callback used to manage exceptions.
member.returns: The names of all the Keys under a section.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Profile.Keys(System.String,System.String,Vi.Tools.Profile.WarningDelegate)
member.summary: Retrives all the 'Keys' belonging to a 'Sections' in an INI file.
member.returns: The names of all the Keys.

member.summary: Reads data from the 'INI' using the method 'GetPrivateProfileString'

The name of the 'key' (in a 'section') from where read data. If null the callback 'onWarning' will be called.
The return value in case something goes wrong.
The full path of the INI file from which read data. If null the callback 'onWarning' will be called.
The number of bytes fetched by the method 'GetPrivateProfileString'. If the buffer is not enough to contain all the data. 'GetPrivateProfileString' is acalled again.
The callback used to manage exceptions.
member.returns: The data read from the INI file. '@default' if something whent wrong. (This method should't raise any exception).

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Profile.Read(System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.String,Vi.Tools.Profile.WarningDelegate)
member.summary: Reads a DateTime from the INI file. The dateTime is stored as a 'long': (the value of the property 'ticks')

The name of the 'key' (in a 'section') from where read data. If null the callback 'onWarning' will be called.
The return value in case something goes wrong.
The full path of the INI file from which read data. If null the callback 'onWarning' will be called.
The callback used to manage exceptions.
member.returns: The data read from the INI file. '@default' if something whent wrong. (This method should't raise any exception).

member.name: T:Vi.Tools.Log
member.summary: Exposes methods to log and format messages: Debug; Info; Warn; Error; Fatal; Format.
Exposes methods to log and format messages: Debug; Info; Warn; Error; Fatal; Format.

member.name: T:Vi.Tools.Log.Levels
member.summary: Enumeration of the possible types of log (method)

member.name: F:Vi.Tools.Log.Levels.DEBUG
member.summary: This is the most verbose logging level (maximum volume setting). Debug should be out-of-bounds for a production system and used only for development and testing.

member.name: F:Vi.Tools.Log.Levels.INFO
member.summary: The 'Info' level is typically used to output information that is useful to the running and management of your system (production). 'Info' would also be the level used to log Entry and Exit points in key grids of your application. However, you may choose to add more entry and exit points at Debug level for more granularity during development and testing.

member.name: F:Vi.Tools.Log.Levels.WARN
member.summary: Warning is often used for handled 'exceptions' or other important log events. For example, if your application requires a configuration setting but has a default in case the setting is missing, then the Warning level should be used to log the missing configuration setting.

member.name: F:Vi.Tools.Log.Levels.ERROR
member.summary: Error is used to log all unhandled exceptions. This is typically logged inside a catch block at the boundary of your application.

member.name: F:Vi.Tools.Log.Levels.FATAL
member.summary: Fatal is reserved for special exceptions/conditions where it is imperative that you can quickly pick out these events. Fatal should to be used early in an application's development. It's usually only with experience it is possible identify situations worthy of the FATAL moniker experience do specific events become worth of promotion to Fatal. After all, an error's an error.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Log.Debug(System.String)
member.summary: This is the most verbose logging level (maximum volume setting). Debug should be out-of-bounds for a production system and used only for development and testing. Logs a 'Debug in the log file if skepDebug (in config file) is false.
member.param: The text to log.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Log.Debug(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: This is the most verbose logging level (maximum volume setting). Debug should be out-of-bounds for a production system and used only for development and testing. Logs a 'Debug in the log file if skepDebug (in config file) is false.
member.param: the message to log in the format used for 'String.Format()'.
The params array like in 'String.Format()'.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Log.Info(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The 'Info' level is typically used to output information useful to the running and management of your system (production). 'Info' would also be the level used to log Entry and Exit points in key grids of your application. However, you may choose to add more entry and exit points at Debug level for more granularity during development and testing.
member.param: The text to log.
The name of the file from where this method is called.
The name of the member where this method is called.
The Line of the file where this method is called.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Log.Info(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: The 'Info' level is typically used to output information useful to the running and management of your system (production). 'Info' would also be the level used to log Entry and Exit points in key grids of your application. However, you may choose to add more entry and exit points at Debug level for more granularity during development and testing.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Log.Warn(System.String)
member.summary: Warning is often used for handled 'exceptions' or other important log events. For example, if your application requires a configuration setting but has a default in case the setting is missing, then the Warning level should be used to log the missing configuration setting.
member.param: The text to log.
The name of the file from where this method is called.
The name of the member where this method is called.
The Line of the file where this method is called.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Log.Warn(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Warning is often used for handled 'exceptions' or other important log events. For example, if your application requires a configuration setting but has a default in case the setting is missing, then the Warning level should be used to log the missing configuration setting.
member.param: The name of the file from where this method is called.
The name of the member where this method is called.
The Line of the file where this method is called.
member.returns: An instance of 'FormatClass' with the method 'Format' used to compose the text to log like the 'String.Format'

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Log.Error(System.Exception)
member.summary: Error is used to log all unhandled exceptions. This is typically logged inside a catch block at the boundary of your application.
member.param: The exception to log.
The line from where this method was called.
The member from where this method was called.
The file from where this method was called.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Log.Fatal(System.String)
member.summary: Fatal is reserved for special exceptions/conditions where it is imperative that you can quickly pick out these events. Fatal should to be used early in an application's development. It's usually only with experience it is possible identify situations worthy of the FATAL moniker experience do specific events become worth of promotion to Fatal. After all, an error's an error.
member.param: The text to log.
The name of the file from where this method is called.
The name of the member where this method is called.
The Line of the file where this method is called.

member.name: T:Vi.Tools.Types.Percent
member.summary: The classical percent. (It's a number less equal 1).

member.name: F:Vi.Tools.Types.Percent.Value
member.summary: Float representation of the value (It's a number less-equal 1).

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Types.Percent.#ctor(System.Single)
member.summary: Main Constructor.
member.param: Il tipo della sede in formato stringa.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Types.Percent.op_Implicit(Vi.Tools.Types.Percent)~System.Single
member.summary: 'Casts' the struct to its original type.
member.param: An instance of 'Percent'.
member.returns: The 'float' associated with this 'struct'. (percent.value

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Types.Percent.op_Implicit(System.Single)~Vi.Tools.Types.Percent
member.summary: 'Casts' the float to Percent.
member.param: The built in typy to cast to Percent.
member.returns: New instance of a 'percent' struct.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Utilities.Join(System.Object[])
member.summary: Una variante del Metodo 'String.Join' Converte il parametro 'value' in una stringa di valori separati da ';' ///
member.param: Lista di oggetti da mettere in sequenza. Di ognuno viene convertito in stringa e vengono rimosse le enetuali occorrenze di ';'. Si esegue 'value[x].ToString().Replace(";", " ").
member.returns: Una sequenza di stringhe separate da ' ; ' (compresi gli spazi). 'null' viene convertito in 'Empty'.

member.name: T:Vi.Tools.Watcher
member.summary: Observes a Directory and it's subDirectories, waiting for changes. If a change occours writes a copy (in a backup diretory) of the file before the change.

member.name: T:Vi.Tools.Watcher.CopyDelegate
member.summary: It's 'boilerplate code': the delegate for the event 'Copy'
member.param: Changes that might occur to a file or directory.
The sub path where the file is stored (relative to the root path from where this watching is 'observing')
The name of the file copied.

member.name: F:Vi.Tools.Watcher.Copy
member.summary: Notifies the ouside world that a backup copy was created.

member.name: T:Vi.Tools.Watcher.ExceptionDelegate
member.summary: It's 'boilerplate code': the delegate for the event 'Exception'

member.name: F:Vi.Tools.Watcher.Exception
member.summary: Notifies the ouside world that an exception occurren in this class.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Watcher.OnException(System.Exception)
member.summary: It's 'boilerplate code', but this method should be called instead of 'this.Exception'.

member.name: F:Vi.Tools.Watcher.FSW
member.summary: The 'pointer' to the watcher!

member.name: P:Vi.Tools.Watcher.Path
member.summary: The directory to monitor, in standard or Universal Naming Convention (UNC) notation.

member.name: P:Vi.Tools.Watcher.Filter
member.summary: The type of files to watch. For example, "*.txt" watches for changes to all 'txt' files.

member.name: P:Vi.Tools.Watcher.Backup
member.summary: The full path of the backup directory, in standard or Universal Naming Convention (UNC) notation.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Watcher.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.IO.NotifyFilters,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize a FileSystemWatcher.
member.param: The full path of the backup directory, in standard or Universal Naming Convention (UNC) notation.
The directory to monitor, in standard or Universal Naming Convention (UNC) notation.
Specifies changes to watch for in a file or folder.
The type of files to watch. For example, "*.txt" watches for changes to all 'txt' files.

member.name: M:Vi.Tools.Watcher.Store(System.IO.FileSystemEventArgs)
member.summary: Creates a copy of the modified file in the backup directory. The backup directory is a 'mirror' of the original directory. Each day there is a new backup diretory under the root folder.
member.param: the parameter provided by all the managed events:{Changed, Created, Deleted, Renamed}

member.name: M:Vi.SQLLogger.Debug(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This is the most verbose logging level (maximum volume setting). Debug should be out-of-bounds for a production system and used only for development and testing.
member.param: The text to log.
The line from where this method was called.
The member from where this method was called.
The file from where this method was called.

member.name: M:Vi.SQLLogger.Fatal(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Fatal is reserved for special exceptions/conditions where it is imperative that you can quickly pick out these events.
member.param: The text to log.
The line from where this method was called.
The member from where this method was called.
The file from where this method was called.

member.name: M:Vi.SQLLogger.Info(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The 'Info' level is typically used to output information that is useful to the running and management of your system (production).
member.param: The text to log.
The line from where this method was called.
The member from where this method was called.
The file from where this method was called.

member.name: M:Vi.SQLLogger.Warn(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Warning is often used for handled 'exceptions' or other important log events.
member.param: The text to log.
The line from where this method was called.
The member from where this method was called.
The file from where this method was called.

member.name: M:Vi.SQLLogger.Error(System.Exception,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Error is used to log all unhandled exceptions.
member.param: The exception to log.
The line from where this method was called.
The member from where this method was called.
The file from where this method was called.
